page.title: 13THE HISTORY OF HEATH HAYES
page.content: Heath Hayes was originally an old mining village. At the height of its mining life there were about eight coal mines in the area. Most of the people who lived in the village were in some way connected with the coal mining industry either as miners, brickyard workers or office workers. The village consisted mainly of terraced houses that were owned by Mining companies for their employees. Nowadays, there are no coal mines in the area, they have all been closed down and very few people are connected with coal mining. The village is far from "dead" though as there are many new housing developments being built. Many people live in Heath Hayes and travel to their places of work.
